sen.j: 正殿（せいでん、しょうでん）は、宮殿、神社、神宮などの中心となる建物。
sen.e: A seiden (shoden) is the central building of a palace, a shrine, etc.
A seiden (shoden) is the central building of a palace, a shrine, etc.
A seiden (shoden) is the central building of a palace, a shrine, etc.

sen.j: 諸儀式が執り行われる。
sen.e: Various ceremonies are held in the seiden.
Various ceremonies are held in the seiden.
Various ceremonies are held in the seiden.

sen.j: 伊勢神宮
sen.e: Ise-jingu shrine
Ise-jingu shrine
Ise-jingu shrine

sen.j: 皇居
sen.e: Imperial palace
Imperial palace
Imperial Palace

sen.j: 明治宮殿の正殿
sen.e: It was the seiden of the Meiji palace.
It was the seiden of the Meiji palace.
Seiden of the Meiji Palace.
sen.cmt: It was the を削除しました。palace→Palace

sen.j: 明治21年（1888年）落成。
sen.e: It was built in 1888.
It was built in 1888.
It was built in 1888.

sen.j: 中庭に対して南面し、木造平屋建て、外観は和風で入母屋造。
sen.e: It was a Japanese style single-story wooden building having a half-hipped roof, located to the north of the courtyard, facing to the south.
It was a Japanese-style single-story wooden building having a half-hipped roof, located to the north of the courtyard, facing toward the south.
It was a Japanese-style single-story wooden building having a half-hipped roof, facing the courtyard to the south.
sen.cmt: ”中庭に対して南面し”という部分を修正しました。

sen.j: 内部は二重格天井。
sen.e: It had a double-lattice ceiling.
It had a double-lattice ceiling.
It had a double-lattice ceiling.

sen.j: シャンデリア、絨毯などを取り入れた和洋折衷であった。
sen.e: Semi-European style interior design was adopted using chandeliers, carpets, etc.
A semi-European style interior design was adopted using chandeliers, carpets, etc.
Wayo-Secchu (Japanese Hybrid Style) was adopted using chandeliers, carpets, etc.
sen.cmt: 和洋折衷: Wayo-Secchu (Japanese Hybrid Style) とし、修正しました。

sen.j: 明治22年（1889年）2月11日大日本帝国憲法発布式典が挙行された。
sen.e: The promulgation ceremony of the Meiji constitution was held in this seiden on February 11, 1889.
The promulgation ceremony of the Meiji constitution was held in this seiden on February 11, 1889.
The promulgation ceremony of the Meiji Constitution was held in this seiden on February 11, 1889.

sen.j: 昭和20年（1945年）の東京大空襲により他の宮殿殿舎とともに焼失した。
sen.e: It was burned down along with other buildings of the palace due to the Great Tokyo Air Raid in 1945.
It was burned down along with other buildings of the palace due to the Great Tokyo Air Raid in 1945.
It was burned down along with other buildings of the palace due to the Great Tokyo Air Raid in 1945.

sen.j: 皇居宮殿の正殿
sen.e: Seiden of the Imperial palace
Seiden of the Imperial palace
Seiden of the Imperial Palace

sen.j: 皇居正殿（せいでん）は、皇居宮殿の中心となる殿舎で、中庭に向かって東面している。
sen.e: The seiden of the Imperial palace is the central building of the palace and located to the west of the courtyard, facing to the east.
The seiden of the Imperial palace is the central building of the palace and is located to the west of the courtyard, facing toward the east.
The Seiden of the Imperial Palace is the central building of the palace and facing the courtyard to the east.
sen.cmt: seiden→Seiden,palace→Palace,”中庭に向かって東面している”という部分を修正しました。

sen.j: 外観は和風、入母屋造り。
sen.e: It is a Japanese style building having a half-hipped roof.
It is a Japanese style building having a half-hipped roof.
Japanese style exterior, having a half-hipped roof.
sen.cmt: ”外観は和風”という部分を修正しました。

sen.j: 屋根の棟には両端に瑞鳥の飾りが設置されている。
sen.e: The ridge of the roof is decorated, at its opposite ends, with an auspicious bird.
The ridge of the roof is decorated, at its opposite ends, with an auspicious bird.
The ridge of the roof is decorated, at its opposite ends, with an auspicious bird.

sen.j: 南側は回廊と、北側は豊明殿とつながっている。
sen.e: The south side and the north side of the seiden are respectively connected to a corridor and Homei-den.
The south side and the north side of the seiden are respectively connected to a corridor and Homei-den.
The south side and the north side of the Seiden are respectively connected to a corridor and Homei-den Hall.
sen.cmt: seiden→Seiden,Homei-den→Homei-den Hall として補強しました。

sen.j: 正殿は、中庭から見て床の高さが3.7メートルある。
sen.e: The floor level of the seiden is 3.7-meter high from the ground level of the courtyard.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The floor level of the seiden is 3.7 meters high from the ground level of the courtyard.
The floor level of the Seiden is 3.7 meters high from the ground level of the courtyard.

sen.j: 宮殿各棟中最も高く位置している。
sen.e: It is the highest among the buildings of the palace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It is the highest among the buildings of the palace.
It is the highest among the buildings of the palace.

sen.j: 正殿には竹の間、松の間、梅の間の三室がある。
sen.e: The seiden includes three rooms: Take-no-ma, Matsu-no-ma, and Ume-no-ma.
The seiden includes three rooms: Take-no-ma, Matsu-no-ma, and Ume-no-ma.
The Seiden includes three chambers: Take-no-ma, Matsu-no-ma, and Ume-no-ma.
sen.cmt: seiden→Seiden,この場合”chambers”の方がより意味すると思われ、修正しました。

sen.j: 平成2年（1990年）正殿松の間に高御座が設置され、今上天皇の即位の礼が挙行された。
sen.e: In 1990, the throne was built in Matsu-no-ma of the seiden and the enthronement ceremony for the Emperor Heisei was held.
In 1990, the throne was built in Matsu-no-ma of the seiden and the enthronement ceremony for the Emperor Heisei was held.
In 1990, the throne was built in Matsu-no-ma of the Seiden and the enthronement ceremony for the Emperor Heisei was held.
